result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincient A Gugliatto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Commencing forthwith.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program only after 18 months of confinement has been served.
Consecutive to: any sentence Defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.  
Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment or school.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall pay Dept. of Corrections supervision fees.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall provide Probation Agent with list of all medications and notify Agent within 48 hours of any changes.
Defendant shall use one pre-approved pharmacy to fill prescriptions.
Defendant shall notify any medical treatment provider of his addiction.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Disposition Form

Def appears in custody & w/Atty John David Dries.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Atty. Dries states the plea questionnaire indicates a cap of 20 months; the court minutes and the State's file notes indicate 24 months.  Short recess.  Reconvene; same appearances.  Court informs counsel that the Court Reporter notes (in rough draft form) dated 2-23-15 indicate that an agreement of 24 months/two years was initially placed on the record.   Statements by counsel.  Defense counsel wishes for Defendant to affirm on the record that he wishes to proceed today based on recommendation.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding the discrepancy between the Defendant's belief on the confinement and the actual recommendation that was placed on the record; Defendant wishes to proceed today with the understanding that the State's recommendation is 24 months of confinement.  Argument by counsel.  Statements by Juanita T. and Kristin G.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Letter received from Lad Lake
Presentence Report e-mailed to DA's office & defense counsel
Sealed

Defendant held pending sentencing
Sentencing hearing on April 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty John David Dries.  Atty Peter Cannon appeared for State.  Resolution reached; PSI recommended and State agrees to cap confinement recommendation at two years.  State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 2 and 3 along with uncharged OAR's dated 3-28-14 and 4-10-14 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1.  2-26-15 Jury trial removed from Court's calendar.  Court revokes bond and Defendant taken into custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Court amends bond to $5,000 cash ($2,000 previously posted) and Defendant taken into custody.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. John Kuczmarski from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests cash bond.  $2,000 cash bond set.  Defendant requests court appointed counsel.
